garten2016morality.title: Morality between the lines: Detecting moral sentiment in text
garten2016morality.author: Garten, Justin and Boghrati, Reihane and Hoover, Joe and Johnson, Kate M and Dehghani, Morteza
garten2016morality.paperMotivationText: Expressions of moral sentiment play a fundamental role in political framing, social solidarity, and basic human motivation. Moral rhetoric helps us communicate the reasoning behind our choices, how we feel we should govern, and the communities to which we belong.
garten2016morality.paperContributionText: The authors compare the accuracy of text analysis methods for detecting moral rhetoric in short (Twitter) and long (political speeches) texts in order to explore shifts in that rhetoric over time.
garten2016morality.paperResultsText: The authors show that combining the MFD with distributed representations allows us to capture a cleaner signal when detecting moral rhetoric, particularly with shortform text. They further demonstrate how the addition of distributed representations can simplify dictionary creation.
